intro: Varronia vasqueziana, commonly known as the Vazquez's varronia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its woody stems, broad leaves, and showy flowers that typically bloom in shades of yellow and orange. It thrives in humid environments and is often found in lowland rainforests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
